message.entry:
Compute linear and angular velocity control commands for following a path using a set of waypoints and the current pose of a differential drive robot.

The input port Pose accepts a three-element state vector of xy-positions and vehicle heading, [x y theta]. The input port Waypoints accepts an N-by-2 matrix as xy-coordinates. The output ports Linear Velocity and Angular Velocity return linear and angular velocities as scalar values, respectively. The Target Direction port outputs an angle with respect to the forward direction of the robot with positive angles measured counter-clockwise. 

Set the Lookahead distance to tune how closely the robot follows the path. A smaller Lookahead distance improves path tracking but can lead to instability.
Data type mismatch. Expected inputs to be of the same data type. Input port Pose is of data type ''{0}'', while input port Waypoints is of data type ''{1}''.
Expected {0} input port value to be positive.
Specify desired linear velocity from input port
Specify lookahead distance from input port
Lookahead Distance and Desired Linear Velocity input ports are not supported for this block in this version of Simulink. Update to R2024a or disable these input ports.
